instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message:
Came in with liquid at smc area, tried reballing smc, now mac boot up fine. But internal ssd not detected, so im sure not an apfs problem.
<CHIP>U3740</CHIP> has proper voltage 3v at pin 1 3 4 6
1v at pin 2
0 volt at pin 7 and 8 with ssd connected.. 
I have tried replacing all caps at pcie data line, no shorted caps
0v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> with ssd connected, I have tried replacing <CHIP>U3710</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3711</CHIP>.. Any advice?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message:
"0v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> with ssd connected"
First check diode mode to ground, w/ and w/o SSD connected.
If all good, change L3700.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: Diode mode to ground is normal 0.478 with/without ssd i havr replaced l3700.but still same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message:
"0v on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL>"
Do you get the voltage now???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: now there's 3.3 volt but still not seeing ssd

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: Clean J3700, inspect PCIE traces and caps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: Cleaned j3700, pcie caps has been replaced, traces is good..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: Yeah, all ssd used is known good, i have used multiple ssd

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message:
Heat CPU with quality flux; try to burn eventually accumulated crap.
Compare diode mode readings on all PCIE data lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: Indeed this board is very dusty and not clean, i have heated pch and tried wiring <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR>, but still doesnt see ssd, pch fault then? ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message: All diode mode is approximately 0.300, except pin 2 of <CAPACITOR>C3710</CAPACITOR>/11/12/13 which is 0v, but i have compared with working board, measured the same so its fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting internal ssd
threads.message:
There should still be something affected by corrosion.
Else, bad PCH...
